title: High school student, 14, tackled to the ground by classmates after he 'pulled out a gun in class'
text:
A 14-year-old boy was tackled to the ground by a group of fellow students after he brandished a handgun during class at a high school in California on Tuesday.

The incident took place at La Habra High School yesterday morning at 9.35am during a metal shop class.

According to witnesses, the 14-year-old freshman, who has not been named because of his age, was showing off the gun to his classmates before he suddenly pointed it at one of them.

Though terrified, Dominic Carrillo and three other students ran towards the boy and wrestled him to the ground, seizing the gun from his hand.

The incident took place at La Habra High School yesterday morning at 9:35pm during a metal shop class

Though terrified, Dominic Carrillo (above) and three other students ran towards the boy and wrestled him to the ground, seizing the gun from his hand

'I pick it up and I see that it's a gun, and it has like a white handle,' student Dominic Carrillo told KCAL. 'It's kind of small, so I was just like, 'oh.' So I jump up and I run, and I go to the desk and I put it down. And the teacher just didn't know what to do.'

Police were called to La Habra High immediately afterwards and the boy was arrested.

Investigators say the gun was not loaded and it remains unclear where he got it from. It's believed the boy could've been trying to sell the weapon to someone at the school.

La Habra high was placed on lockdown briefly as a precaution during the police response officials described as a 'threat'.

'We are currently on lock down as a precaution. All students are safe. Please stay off campus at this time,' the school tweeted in an update.

No one was injured and there aren't any other threats to the school, police said.

Witness Maria Martinez recalled the moment she saw the gun come out of the boy's waistband.

She said she believed the boy was 'just messing around' with the gun, but took 'the joke too far' and startled his classmates when he aimed it at one of them.

The boy was interviewed by officers on Tuesday who are yet to determine whether he will be charged with a crime.

The La Habra Police Department has not yet responded to a DailyMail.com request for comment.
description: The incident took place at La Habra High School yesterday morning at 9:35pm during a metal shop class. Dominic Carrillo tackled the boy after he pulled out the gun and aimed it at a student.
